entry.title: Bridge returned error 500! (18675)
entry.content:

Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry

entry.title: When: Friday, Feb 26 from 4-9pm, MST & Saturday, Feb 27 from...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

When: Friday, Feb 26 from 4-9pm, MST & Saturday, Feb 27 from 9am-4pm, MST
Where: Virtual – Registration required
This event is FREE and open to everyone in the community! Please join us online.
To register, visit: https://whova.com/web/cbhs_202102/
The 2021 Collaborative Black Health Summit will provide you with relevant and actionable information and connect you to community resources! CAA Health is creating a space of mutual support and connectedness to showcase strategies ...and best practices for helping our community members achieve their highest level of health and well-being.
The summit will feature a variety of speakers, presentations, and interactive breakout sessions. Here are some highlights of what to expect:
- Keynote by Dr. Terri Richardson and a panel discussion on COVID-19 health and vaccine information featuring, Dr. Oswaldo "Ozzie" Grenardo, Dr. Sheila Davis & Dr. Stephaun Wallace
- A presentation by Morehouse School of Medicine’s National COVID-19 Resiliency Network (NCRN)
- Entertainment by performing artists, including Tony Exum Jr., Dianne Reeves, and Mr. Charles Doss & The Let’s Start Dancing Crew
- Data on health/healthcare outcomes and disparities
- How to find and access community resources and assistance programs
- How to stay healthy and socially connected
- Learn skills and receive training and tips for self-care, parenting, health advocacy, and community engagement
Please consider subscribing to our e-newsletter to stay up-to-date on events and service offerings at www.caahealth.org.
Any questions? Please contact Eric Moore at Eric@caahealth.org or 303-355-3423 ext. 112.

See More

FRI, FEB 26 - FEB 27

Collaborative Black Health Summit

Online Event49 people interested

entry.title: If you're unclear on why image descriptions are necessary,...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

If you're unclear on why image descriptions are necessary, or why all caps in hashtags are a problem, please read! We owe it to our disabled community members to strive to be more access-centered in everything we do. And since everything we do is now posted to social media there are some easy steps we can take to to not leave folks out of the conversation. #BlackDisabledLivesMatter #AccessCentered #Accessibility

https://www.shondaland.com/…/make-your-social-media-more-a…/

AOC's consistent use of video captioning is definitely leading the way.

shondaland.com

Is Your Social Media Accessible to Everyone? These 9 Best Practices Can Help

AOC's consistent use of video captioning is definitely leading the way.AOC's consistent use of video captioning is definitely leading the way.

entry.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Denzel CaldwellGood Morning. Drink some water. Pour some libations for our Ancestors. Day 16 of #blackhistorymonth ...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280Denzel Caldwell

Good Morning. Drink some water. Pour some libations for our Ancestors.

Day 16 of #blackhistorymonth

"Left of Marx: The Political Life of Black Communist Clau...dia Jones" by Carole Bryce Davies

The work and contributions of Black Leftist revolutionaries are rich and spread throughout their Diaspora. It is especially important that we note the work of our Sisters who engaged in protracted revolutionary struggle, because there is currently an attempt to absorb them into the status quo.

Comrade Claudia Jones work was so deeply principled and impactful that she was buried to the left of Karl Marx. Know her name. Study her life.

Have a great day.

See More

entry.title: This is the same chemical that was likely used in Denver all...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

This is the same chemical that was likely used in Denver all summer too, jsyk.

#DefundThePolice

"The United States’s routine use of potentially lethal chemical weapons in urban areas, often during peaceful or nonviolent protests, in ways that affect the entire populace as well as the environment. “I plead with all law enforcement agencies who have HC in their arsenal to decommission it immediately,” Simonis said. “There is no reason for any police agency to possess it.”

...

https://truthout.org/…/police-deployed-potentially-lethal-…/

See MoreThe hexachloroethane smoke that police used against protesters can cause vomiting, respiratory distress and even death.

truthout.org

Police Deployed Potentially Lethal Chemical During Black Lives Matter Protests

entry.title: “As winter drags on, people must reimagine the ways they’ve...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

“As winter drags on, people must reimagine the ways they’ve been surviving the pandemic, says Apryl Alexander, a clinical and forensic psychologist and an associate professor at the University of Denver’s Graduate School of Professional Psychology. “With economic strain and cold weather comes the loss of many of the activities — online shopping and outdoor activities — that were giving us distractions and connections,” Alexander says.”

With more than 450,000 dead and no clear end in sight, some have found tools for coping with loss and stress are no longer working.

vox.com

What you’re feeling is grief

With more than 450,000 dead and no clear end in sight, some have found tools for coping with loss and stress are no longer working.With more than 450,000 dead and no clear end in sight, some have found tools for coping with loss and stress are no longer working.

entry.title: Black Lives Matter 5280The RootShe made you wanna dance w/ somebody. She reminded you not to cry, because on earth we weren’t meant to...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280The Root

She made you wanna dance w/ somebody.

She reminded you not to cry, because on earth we weren’t meant to stay

She was a mathematician, because if 6 of y’all went... out, then 4 of you were really cheap

She was every woman & she will always be THE VOICE.

Rest Easy Whitney Houston! #BlackExcellence

entry.title: Innovation in Colorado is all around us, especially in the field...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Innovation in Colorado is all around us, especially in the field of housing and homelessness. Hear from experts on some alternatives that make headlines for creative, thoughtful, and compassionate approaches when traditional housing options are hard to come by.

This event is part of the Colorado Coalition for the Homeless 2021 Education Series.

This event is free and everyone is welcome to join.

...

Panelists include:
-Cole Chandler, Executive Director, Colorado Village Collaborative
-Joseph Zanovitch, Executive Director, HOPE of Longmont
-Jenna Salerno, Street Medicine Program Nurse, Colorado Coalition for the Homeless
-Dave Neuhausel, Pastor, Denver Community Church
-Robin Wood-Mason, Director of Development & Communications, The Delores Project

See More

WED, FEB 17 AT 5:00 PM MST

Alternatives to Homelessness: Innovative Solutions That Work

Online EventCauses · 437 people

entry.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Boulder County Public HealthStreet drugs in Boulder County have been found to contain Fentanyl. They are Xanax and...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280Boulder County Public Health

Street drugs in Boulder County have been found to contain Fentanyl. They are Xanax and Oxycodone 30 mg pills currently being circulated in the community. Fentan...yl is 50-100 times more potent than heroin, and significantly increases the risk of death from accidental overdose. Anyone who may use street drugs, or knows someone who does, should keep Naloxone (an overdose reversal drug) with them at all times. Read more in the press release at www.boco.org/Fentanyl0221

See More

entry.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
